creator_2: H. P. Oosterhuis J. A. Lutz
physical_appearance: This is  a multicoloured aquatint depicting the surrender of Sultan Mahmud Badaruddin II after the Dutch expedition against Palembang in 1821. Most of aquatint is covered by Dutch vessels and flags. There are three lines of text in Dutch at the bottom of the aquatint specifying the title of this scene of surrender.
sgcool_label_text: In 1821, the Dutch launched an expedition against Sultan Mahmud Badaruddin of Palembang, who had been hostile against Dutch. The expedition was successful, and the Sultan is depicted in this print being escorted to the Dutch vessel Joanna, later to be exiled to Ternate. This aquatint was produced by J. A. Lutz, after an original work by H. P. Oosterhuis.
title_text: Surrender of Sultan Mahmud Badaruddin II after the Dutch expedition against Palembang
subject_terms_1: expeditions (journeys) schooners watercraft flags illustrations (layout features) proofs (prints by function)
subject_terms_2: Aquatint Schooners Boats and boating Flags Pictures Mahmud Badaruddin II, Sultan of Palembang, 1768-1852
